intro: Carmichaelia floribunda, commonly known as the Kauri daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often woody and somewhat branched. Carmichaelia floribunda plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for native pollinators.
